short_description: From the rugged outback to the stunning Great Barrier Reef, Australia is a country of diverse landscapes and unique wildlife. Explore vibrant cities, indulge in delicious cuisine, and experience the laid-back Aussie lifestyle

alcohol_info: All states restrict purchasing to over 18, but exceptions may apply if accompanied by a parent or guardian

tipping.hotels: Not expected in hotels as staff are paid adequately
tipping.guides: Not expected but always appreciated if you feel if the tour was excellent
tipping.restaurants: Not expected and generally bills already include service charge
tipping.taxis: Not required but common practice to 'keep the change'

weather.title: Australia has a diverse climate due to its vast size, ranging from tropical in the north to arid in the central regions and temperate in the south. The country experiences hot summers, particularly in the interior, and mild winters, with varying rainfall patterns and temperature extremes across different regions

when_to_visit.title: Sightseeing
when_to_visit.time_period: Spring (September to November), Autumn (March to May)
when_to_visit.short_description: For southern regions such as Melbourne and Sydney, spring and autumn offer comfortable temperatures enjoyable for city exploration and outdoor activities

when_to_visit.title: Dry season
when_to_visit.short_description: For tropical regions of Northern Australia like Cairns, dry season offers warmer weather with less rainfall

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Hot and humid, particularly in northern parts. Can still be a good time to enjoy beach activities around coastal areas

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Australia is during the spring (September to November) and autumn (March to May) seasons when the weather is generally mild and pleasant in most regions, offering ideal conditions for outdoor activities, exploring cities, and enjoying Australia's diverse natural beauty
